challenge.description: Difficulty in achieving complete lithium extraction beyond the composition Li0.5[Mn2]O4.
challenge.impact: Limits the ability to fully delithiate the material, which is critical for its application as an electrode in lithium-ion batteries.

solution.description: Electrochemical extraction was attempted at low current rates.
solution.methodology: Electrochemical techniques with controlled current rates.
solution.effectiveness: The extraction was still difficult, indicating limitations in the approach.

evidence.data: Observation of difficulty in lithium extraction even at low current rates.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with lithium ions occupying tetrahedral and octahedral sites.
context.experimental_conditions: Electrochemical extraction performed at low current rates.
context.application_relevance: Critical for optimizing the material's performance as a lithium-ion battery electrode.

challenge.description: Low scattering power of X-rays by lithium ions, making it difficult to determine their exact positions in the structure.
challenge.impact: Complicates the structural refinement and accurate determination of lithium ion distribution.

solution.description: Neutron diffraction techniques were used to overcome the limitations of X-ray diffraction.
solution.methodology: Neutron diffraction, which provides better sensitivity to lithium ions.
solution.effectiveness: Successfully determined lithium ion positions, confirming their distribution over tetrahedral and octahedral sites.

evidence.data: Neutron diffraction data showing lithium ion distribution in both tetrahedral and octahedral sites.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with lithium ions distributed across tetrahedral and octahedral sites.
context.experimental_conditions: Neutron diffraction performed at specific wavelengths (1.3840 Å and 1.5082 Å).
context.application_relevance: Essential for understanding lithium ion behavior in battery applications.

challenge.description: Phase transition observed near the composition Li0.5[Mn2]O4, with a sudden decrease in lattice parameter.
challenge.impact: Uncertainty in the nature of the phase transition affects the stability and performance of the material in battery applications.

solution.description: Further structural analysis was conducted to investigate lithium-ion ordering and its role in the phase transition.
solution.methodology: Neutron diffraction and structural refinement techniques.
solution.effectiveness: The exact nature of the phase transition remains unresolved, indicating the need for additional studies.

evidence.source: Discussion on phase transition and lattice parameter changes (6).
evidence.data: Sharp decrease in lattice parameter from 8.14 Å to 8.05 Å at x = 0.5.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with lithium ions occupying tetrahedral and octahedral sites.
context.experimental_conditions: Lithium extraction leading to phase transition near x = 0.5.
context.application_relevance: Understanding phase transitions is crucial for ensuring material stability in lithium-ion batteries.
